org.logicmill.util

Interface LargeHashMap<K,V>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - type of the keys maintained in this map
    V - type of the mapped values

    public interface LargeHashMap<K,V>
    An object that maps keys to values. A map cannot contain duplicate keys; each key can map to at most one value.

    This interface is based on Map<K,V> and ConcurrentMap<K,V>, but it is specifically intended to support maps of very large size (greater than 232 entries). It differs from java.util.Map<K,V> and java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<K,V> in the following ways:

    1. It omits methods that would entail a full traversal of the map in a single method, such as Map.containsValue(Object).
    2. It omits methods that would return the contents of the entire map as anther collection view, such as Map.entrySet().
    3. As an alternative to collection views, it provides an iterator for map entries (associated key/value pairs).
    4. It employs 64-bit hash codes, by way of a key adapter object.
    The omissions are motivated by the impracticality of such operations on maps of extremely large size. Because of these differences, this interface and its implementations are not participants in the Java Collections Framework.

    Key adapters

    Every instance of an implementation of LargeHashMap must have exactly one associated key adapter object that implements LargeHashMap.KeyAdapter<K>. The key adapter acts as an intermediary between the map and key objects. Specifically, it generates 64-bit hash codes from keys, and it compares keys to determine whether a key parameter (such as the parameter to get(Object key)) matches a key stored in the map. See LargeHashMap.KeyAdapter for discussion of how to implement key adapters.

    Implementations of LargeHashMap has certain responsibilities with respect to key adapters:

    • Implementations must provide a mechanism for associating a key adapter object with a hash map instance. Typically, a reference to a key adapter would be passed as a parameter to the constructor of the map implementation.
    • Whenever an implementation requires a hash code value from a key, the map implementation must obtain it by invoking KeyAdapter.getLongHashCode(Object key) on the key adapter associated with the map. Map implementations can rely on the immutability of LargeHashMap.Entry objects to guarantee that a key (and thus, its associated hash code) will not change for the life time of the entry, permitting hash codes to be stored with keys to avoid the cost of re-computing hash codes.
    • Whenever an implementation needs to compare a keys for equivalence, it must invoke KeyAdapter.keyMatches(K mapKey, Object key) on the key adapter associated with the map, where mapKey is a key stored in a map entry, and key is a key provided as a parameter to the method being executed. See LargeHashMap.KeyAdapter.keyMatches(Object, Object) for a detailed discussion. The descriptions of methods on LargeHashMap that use keys discuss the specific ways in which map implementations should rely on key adapters for comparing keys.
    Author:
    David Curtis

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  LargeHashMap.Entry<K,V>
      A map entry that encapsulates a key/value pair.
      static interface  LargeHashMap.KeyAdapter<K>
      An adapter object that acts as an intermediary between implementations of LargeHashMap and classes used as keys in those implementations.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsKey(java.lang.Object key)
      Returns true if this map contains a mapping for the specified key.
      V get(java.lang.Object key)
      Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key.

      Returns an iterator over the entries contained in this map.

      Returns true if this map contains no key-value mappings.

      Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map.

    • Method Detail

      • containsKey

        boolean containsKey(java.lang.Object key)
        Returns true if this map contains a mapping for the specified key. More formally, returns true f this map contains a mapping from a key k to a value v such that
         
        adapter.keyMatches(k, key) == true
        where adapter is the key adapter associated with this map.
        Parameters:
        key - key whose presence in this map is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if this map contains a mapping for the specified key
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if key is null

      • get

        V get(java.lang.Object key)
        Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key. More formally, if this map contains a mapping from a key k to a value v such that
         
        adapter.keyMatches(k, key) == true
        (where adapter is the key adapter associated with this map) then this method returns v; otherwise it returns null. There can be at most one such mapping.
        Parameters:
        key - the key whose associated value is to be returned
        Returns:
        the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if key is null

      • putIfAbsent

        V putIfAbsent(K key,
            V value)
        Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map, only if the specified key is not already present in the map. This is equivalent to
        
        if (!map.containsKey(key)) {
                return map.put(key,value);
        } else return map.get(key);
        except that the action is performed atomically.
        Parameters:
        key - key with which the specified value is to be associated
        value - value to be associated with the specified key
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the specified key, or null if there was no mapping for the key
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if key or value is null

      • put

        V put(K key,
    V value)
        Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map. If the map previously contained a mapping for the key (that is, if containsKey(key) returns true), the old value is replaced by the specified value.
        Parameters:
        key - key with which the specified value is to be associated
        value - value to be associated with the specified key
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with key, or {code@ null} if there was no mapping for key
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if key or value is null

      • remove

        V remove(java.lang.Object key)
        Removes the mapping for the specified key from this map if it is present. More formally, if this map contains a mapping from a key k to a value v such that
         
        adapter.keyMatches(k, key) == true
        (where adapter is the key adapter associated with this map) then that mapping is removed. Returns the value associated with the specified key in this map, or null if the key was not present in the map.
        Parameters:
        key - the key whose mapping is to be removed from the map
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with key, or null if there was no mapping for key
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if key is null

      • remove

        boolean remove(java.lang.Object key,
             java.lang.Object value)
        Removes the entry for a key only if currently mapped to a given value. This is equivalent to
        
        if (map.containsKey(key) && map.get(key).equals(value)) {
                map.remove(key);
                return true;
        } else return false;
        except that the action is performed atomically.
        Parameters:
        key - key with which the specified value is associated
        value - value expected to be associated with the specified key
        Returns:
        true if the value was removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if key or value is null

      • replace

        V replace(java.lang.Object key,
        V value)
        Replaces the entry for a key only if currently mapped to some value. This is equivalent to 
        
        if (map.containsKey(key)) {
                return map.put(key, value);
        } else return null;
        except that the action is performed atomically.
        Parameters:
        key - key with which the specified value is associated
        value - value to be associated with the specified key
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the specified key, or null if there was no mapping for the key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if key or value is null

      • replace

        boolean replace(java.lang.Object key,
              V oldValue,
              V newValue)
        Replaces the entry for a key only if currently mapped to a given value. This is equivalent to
        
        if (map.containsKey(key) && map.get(key).equals(value)) {
                map.put(key, newValue);
                return true;
        } else return false;
        except that the action is performed atomically.
        Parameters:
        key - key with which the specified value is associated
        oldValue - value expected to be associated with the specified key
        newValue - value to be associated with the specified key
        Returns:
        true if the value was replaced, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if key, oldValue or newValue is null

      • size

        long size()
        Returns the number of key-value entries in this map.
        Returns:
        the number of key-value entries in this map

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this map contains no key-value mappings.
        Returns:
        true if this map contains no key-value mappings

      • getEntryIterator

        java.util.Iterator<LargeHashMap.Entry<K,V>> getEntryIterator()
        Returns an iterator over the entries contained in this map.

        There are no guarantees concerning the order in which the entries are returned.

        Returns:
        an iterator over the entries in this map
